summary: This is an email chain from December 1, 2019, between individuals associated with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY), discussing a New York Times article about Patrick Kessler. The article details Kessler's attempts to convince attorneys David Boies and Stanley Pottinger that he possessed video evidence of sexual abuse by figures associated with Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondents express skepticism about Kessler's credibility.

persons.name: Patrick Kessler
persons.role: Individual claiming to possess video evidence
persons.context: Described in the forwarded New York Times article as an apparent con man who attempted to convince attorneys David Boies and Stanley Pottinger that he had video evidence of sexual abuse by figures associated with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: One of the attorneys whom Patrick Kessler allegedly tried to convince about possessing video evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein associates, as reported in the New York Times article.

persons.name: Stanley Pottinger
persons.context: One of the attorneys whom Patrick Kessler allegedly tried to convince about possessing video evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein associates, as reported in the New York Times article.

persons.name: Julie Brown
persons.context: A journalist (likely Julie K. Brown of the Miami Herald) who was spoken to about Patrick Kessler and was reportedly skeptical of him, as mentioned in the email.

connections.description: Kessler allegedly attempted to contact and convince Boies that he possessed video evidence related to Epstein associates.
Kessler allegedly attempted to contact and convince Pottinger that he possessed video evidence related to Epstein associates.

events.title: New York Times Article Publication
events.description: The New York Times publishes an article titled 'Jeffrey Epstein, Blackmail and a Lucrative `Hot List'' detailing Patrick Kessler's attempts to sell alleged video evidence to attorneys.

events.title: SDNY Email Discussion
events.description: Individuals associated with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY exchange emails discussing the New York Times article and expressing skepticism about Patrick Kessler's credibility.

keyFacts: A New York Times article from November 30, 2019, reported on Patrick Kessler's attempts to convince attorneys David Boies and Stanley Pottinger he had video evidence of sexual abuse by figures associated with Jeffrey Epstein.
The email correspondents from the SDNY express skepticism, with one stating the story makes Kessler 'seem like a scammer.'
Journalist Julie Brown was reportedly skeptical of Patrick Kessler when spoken to about him.
The email chain shows SDNY personnel monitoring and discussing media reports related to the Epstein case in December 2019.
